tit.cmt: *統一用語リストにはKannosan-jo Castleとあったのですが、読みは「かんの・お・さんじょう」と「の・お」は長音ではないので、以下kannoosan-joと表記しました。

sen.j: 神尾山城（かんのおさんじょう）は、京都府亀岡市宮前町宮川にあった城。
sen.e: Kannoosan-jo Castle was a castle existed in present Miyagawa, Miyazaki-cho, Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Kannoosan-jo Castle was a castle that existed in what is now Miyagawa, Miyazaki-cho, Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 柳本賢治の居城で、その後明智光秀の丹波国攻めの基地になったのではないかと思われる。
sen.e: It is supposed to have been used by Kataharu YANAGOMOTO as his residence, and later by Mitsuhide AKECHI as a base to attack Tanba Province.
It is thought to have been used by Kataharu YANAGOMOTO as his residence, and later by Mitsuhide AKECHI as a base from which to attack Tanba Province.

sen.j: 神尾山城は金輪寺の裏山にあった山城で、金輪寺の周辺には、極楽坊跡、竹中坊跡、宝蔵坊跡、東柳坊跡など、数多い寺坊跡があり、天台宗天台密教の霊地で今も石垣がそのまま残っている。
sen.e: Kannoosan-jo Castle was built on a mountain at the back of Kinrin-ji Temple, and in its surroundings inside the temple ground, there still remain the ruins of lodgings for visitors or pilgrims' lodgings), such as Gokuraku-bo, Chikuchu-bo (竹中坊跡,), 宝蔵坊跡Hozo-bo, 東柳坊Toryu-bo (東柳).
sen.cmt: 寺坊跡→定訳不明：ruins of lodgings for visitors or pilgrims' lodgings)としました。竹中坊→Chikuchu-bo (竹中坊) [正しい読み方不明です] 東柳坊→Toryu-bo (東柳) [正しい読み方不明です]
sen.e: Kannoosan-jo Castle stood on a mountain behind Kinrin-ji Temple, in the surrounding area of which there remain the ruins of many temple living quarters for Buddhist monks and nuns such as Gokuraku-bo, Chikuchu-bo, Hozo-bo and Toryu-bo, and the site is also a sacred place of Tendai Esoteric Buddhism, with a stone wall that still stands.

sen.j: 神尾山城はその聖地に築城され、巨石怪石を利用した特徴のある大形山城であった。
sen.e: Kannoosan-jo Castle was built in that sacred place, demonstrating a characteristic figure of a large-sized mountain castle constructed with strange-shaped big stones
Kannoosan-jo Castle was built on this sacred site, and was a large structure which was distinctively constructed from large and strangely shaped stones.

sen.j: 亀岡市街地から西方約16km、西丹波の篠山市に抜ける山陰道に沿った山に築かれており、標高は359m、比高230mの山頂一帯にある。
sen.e: It was constructed on the crest of a mountain at 359m elevation and 230m relative elevation, 16km west from the center of Kameoka City, along the Sanin-do Road that leads to Shinoyama City in Nishi Tanba.

It was constructed on the peak of a mountain with an altitude of 359m and a relative height of 230m that stands approximately 16km west of the center of Kameoka City, on the Sanin-do Road that led to Shinoyama City in Nishi Tanba.

sen.j: 神尾山城が史上に現れるのが桂川原の戦い八上・神尾山両城の戦いの時で、大永6年（1526年）の初旬、細川尹賢が摂津国で築城していた。
sen.e: The first appearance of the Kannoosan-jo Castle in a historical material can be found in the descriptions on the Battle of Katsuragawa River, and the Battles of Yagami-jo Castle and Kannoosan-jo Castle, and from there it can be understood that in the early 1529, Tadakata HOSOKAWA constructed a castle called Kannoosan-jo Castle in Settsu Province

sen.j: この時の様子を『足利季世紀』では「尼崎ノ城」（大物城）と記述されているが、『新修 大阪市史第２巻』によると細川氏典厩家の本拠は中嶋で尼崎は含まれていないので、堀城の誤りではないかと指摘している。
sen.e: According to "Ashikaga kiseiki" it was described as 'Amagasaki-no-jo' (Daimotsu-jo), however, "Shinshu Osaka-shi Shi" (History of Osaka: new edition) Vol.2 pointed out that the Hosokawa Tenkyu family had its home base in Nakajima area but it did not cover Amagasaki area, therefore 'Amagasaki-jo Castle' should be read as 'Hori-jo Castle.'

sen.j: この城の作事に香西元盛も加わっていた。

sen.j: そんな中、細川尹賢の人夫と香西元盛の人夫が「土一簀」で口論となり、双方の人夫が喧嘩をはじめた。
sen.e: Meanwhile, a quarrel between a laborer of Tadakata HOSOKAWA and a laborer of Motomori KOZAI about 'a basketful of dirt' provoked a conflict between the laborers of the both party.

sen.j: いったん両者とも引き分けたが、腹の虫が収まらなかった香西元盛の人夫が城中に瓦等投げ込んだりしたので、細川尹賢の憎悪感は頂点になった。
sen.e: The conflict ended in a draw at one time, but since some frustrated laborers of the Motomori KOZAI side threw roof tiles and other things into the Tadakata's castle, Tadakata HOSOKAWA became filled with resentment.

sen.j: 細川尹賢は香西元盛が無学であるのを利用して、偽の謀反書を細川高国に差出、驚いた細川高国は同年7月13日香西元盛を謀殺した。
sen.e: Tadakata HOSOKAWA, taking advantage of Motomori KOZAI's ignorance, forwarded a falsified Motonari's letter of rebellion to Takakuni HOSOKAWA, and Takakuni HOSOKAWA, who was frightened, murdered Motomori KOZAI on July 31 of the same year (1529).

sen.j: 逆に激怒した香西元盛の兄弟の波多野稙通と柳本賢治は細川高国に反旗を翻し、八上・神尾山城両城の戦い、桂川原の戦いに続いていく。
sen.e: Furious Motonari KOZAI's brothers, in return, rose in revolt against Takakuni HOSOKAWA, and this revolt subsequently lead to the Battles of Yagami-jo Castle and Kannoosan-jo Castle, and to the Battle of Katsurakawara.

Motonari KOZAI's brothers Tanemichi HATANO and Kataharu YANAGIMOTO were enraged and revolted against Takakuni HOSOKAWA, triggering a battle between Yagami-jo Castle and Kannoosan-jo Castle as well as the Battle of Katsurakawara.

sen.j: その後、柳本賢治は中嶋の戦いで暗殺され、細川高国は大物崩れで自害、細川尹賢も殺害され、一旦城史は不明となる。
sen.e: Afterwards, as Kataharu YANAGIMOTO was assassinated in the Battle of Nakanoshima, Takakuni HOSOKAWA killed himself at Daimotsu-kuzure (the Battle of Daimotsu), and Tadakata HOSOKAWA was also murdered, and since then the history of the castle became unknown for a while.

sen.e: It might be the description about the time when Harumoto HOSOKAWA went down to Tanba Province, when he felt threatened by Motoharu UENO, tsunakata of the Hosokawa clan, who entered in Kyoto on September 13 of the same year to conquer him.

sen.e: By this, it can be imagined that there was a residences with a certain scale, which might have been equipped with the elements of mountain castle.
From these, it can be assumed that fairly large residences once stood on the site, and that these were elements of a permanent mountain castle.
sen.cmt: ・「By this」→「From these」・「imagined」→「assumed」・原文を反映するように書き直し
sen.e: From these, it can be assumed that fairly large residences once stood on the site, and that these were elements of a permanent mountain castle.

sen.j: また、北側曲輪には亀岡市ではここだけにしか存在しない畝状空堀（竪掘跡）があり、形状から明智光秀時代の改修が指摘されている。
sen.e: In addition, the north side kuruwa has a furrow-shaped dry canal (remains of pit), which indicates that it underwent a modification during the rule of Mitsuhide AKECHI, judging from the form.
sen.cmt: 畝状空堀（竪掘跡）→定訳不明： furrow-shaped dry canal (remains of pit)としました。
sen.e: In addition, the northern compound has a furrow-shaped dry moat (remains of a vertical-sided moat) that exists only in Kameoka City, which, judging from its form, appears to have undergone modification during the rule of Mitsuhide AKECHI.
sen.cmt: ・「north side kuruwa」→「northern compound」・「canal」→「moat」・「pit」→「a vertical-sided moat」・翻訳漏れを修正・「undewent」→「undergone」・「a」を削除・再構成
sen.e: In addition, the northern compound has a furrow-shaped dry moat (remains of a vertical-sided moat) that exists only in Kameoka City, which, judging from its form, appears to have undergone modification during the rule of Mitsuhide AKECHI.

sen.j: また、現在は南側曲輪から主曲輪にある土塁跡の脇を通過して北側曲輪への侵入は可能だが、当時は多聞風櫓が南北を遮断しており、西側にある曲輪帯曲輪・腰曲輪を通って北側曲輪と南側曲輪をいききしていたと思われている。
sen.e: At present, it is possible to go to the north side kuruwa from the south side kuruwa, passing alongside the remain of earthen mound in the main kuruwa, but at that time, the vigilance tower (多聞風櫓) blocked the passing from south to north, and therefore, it is considered that to come and go between the north side and the south side kuruwa, the people were passing through the kuruwa compound in the west side consisted of obikuruwa (a long narrow castle compound) and koshiguruwa (the compound bounded by earthworks).
sen.cmt: vigilance tower (多聞風櫓)→正しい読み方が不明です。
sen.e: At present, it is possible to enter the northern compound from the southern compound, passing alongside the remains of the earthen mound in the main compound, but at the time of the castle's construction, the tamon yagura blocked passage from south to north, and it is therefore thought that people would pass between the northern and southern compounds by passing through the obikuruwa (a long narrow castle compound) and koshiguruwa (a compound bounded by earthworks) that comprised the western compound.
sen.cmt: ・「go to」→「enter」・「north side kuruwa」→「northern compound」・「south side kuruwa」→「southern compound」・「remain」→「remains」・「the」を追加・「kuruwa」→「compound」・「that time」→「the time of the castle's construction」・「vigilance tower (多聞風櫓)」→「tamon yagura」・「the passing」→「passage」・「and therefore, it is considered」→「and it is therefore thought」・文の後半を書き直し
sen.e: At present, it is possible to enter the northern compound from the southern compound, passing alongside the remains of the earthen mound in the main compound, but at the time of the castle's construction, the tamon yagura blocked passage from south to north, and it is therefore thought that people would pass between the northern and southern compounds by passing through the obikuruwa (a long narrow castle compound) and koshiguruwa (a compound bounded by earthworks) that comprised the western compound.

sen.j: 南側曲輪は主曲輪より南側と南西側の2つ支脈の稜線に曲輪が配されている。
sen.e: In the south side kuruwa compound is constructed on the two feeding crests that extends from the main kuruwa to the south and to the southwest, respectively
The southern compound is constructed on the two feeding crests that extend from the main compound to the south and to the southwest.
sen.cmt: ・「In the south side kuruwa compound」→「The southern compound」・「extends」→「extend」・「kuruwa」→「compound」・「, respectively」を削除・ペリオドを補足
sen.e: The southern compound is constructed on the two feeding crests that extend from the main compound to the south and to the southwest.

sen.j: 南側の曲輪は高低差があり7段の階段状になっており、その中ほどに上部3.5m、底部2m、高さ3mの堀切が存在している。
sen.e: The south side kuruwa, which has a difference in level, is a stepped ground with seven different levels, and in the middle of the compound there was a ditch of 3.5m in top 2m in bottom, and 3m in height.
The southern compound varies in height with seven stepped levels, and in the center is a dry moat which has a width of 3.5m at the top, 2m at the bottom and a height of 3m.
The southern compound varies in height with seven stepped levels, and in the center is a dry moat which has a width of 3.5m at the top, 2m at the bottom and a height of 3m.

sen.j: 南西側の尾根沿いにも3,4段程度の曲輪がある。
sen.e: Along the ridge in the southwest side, there is another with 3 or 4 levels.
There are also compounds with three and four levels along the southwestern ridge.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように翻訳し直し
sen.e: There are also compounds with three and four levels along the southwestern ridge.

sen.j: ここには「天狗岩」という巨石があり、霊場の景観を呈していることから、南西側の曲輪は金輪寺の寺院敷地を利用したとも考えられている。
sen.e: Here, there is a huge stone called 'Tengu-iwa,' (Tengu rock, or long-nosed goblin shaped rock), representing a mountain spirit, and therefore, it might be possible that the south west side kuruwa was constructed making use of the land of Kinrin-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 「天狗岩」→定訳不明： 'Tengu-iwa,' (Tengu rock, or long-nosed goblin shaped rock)としました。
sen.e: Here there is a large rock called 'Tengu-iwa' (Tengu rock, or long-nosed goblin shaped rock), representing a mountain spirit, and it is therefore thought that the southwestern compound was constructed on the grounds of Kinrin-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: ・コンマを２つ削除・「huge stone」→「large rock」・文の後半を翻訳し直し
sen.e: Here there is a large rock called 'Tengu-iwa' (Tengu rock, or long-nosed goblin shaped rock), representing a mountain spirit, and it is therefore thought that the southwestern compound was constructed on the grounds of Kinrin-ji Temple.

sen.j: また、この南側と南西側の中間部分に「曲輪水の手曲輪」と丹波地方では珍しい曲輪跡がある。
sen.e: Also there is a ruin of kuruwa that can be rarely seen in Tanba district, called 'mizu-no-te guruwa' (a castle compound equipped with water withdrawal and storage facility for the castle), in the middle of the south and southwest sides.
sen.cmt: 「曲輪水の手曲輪」→「水の手曲輪」→'mizu-no-te guruwa' (a castle compound equipped with water withdrawal and storage facility for the castle)としました。
sen.e: In between the southern and southwestern sides is a "mizu-no-te guruwa" (castle compound built to protect the source of a castle's water) - rare in the Tanba region.
sen.cmt: 用語共有のデータベースに基づき、翻訳し直し
sen.e: In between the southern and southwestern sides is the remains of "mizu-no-te guruwa" (castle compound built to protect the source of a castle's water) - rare in the Tanba region.

sen.j: これは4段目曲輪の最上部に1.5mの井戸跡があり、そこから湧水式の水路がほどこされ、水のはった曲輪になる。
sen.e: There, a ruin of well with the dimension of 1.5m is found at the top of the kuruwa that has four levels, and from there a spring-fed canal leads to the kuruwa full of water.
The uppermost fourth level of this compound contains the remains of a well with a diameter of 1.5m from which a spring-fed aqueduct was built to provide the castle with water.
The uppermost fourth level of this compound contains the remains of a well with a diameter of 1.5m from which a spring-fed aqueduct was built to provide the castle with water.

sen.j: その隣の南側曲輪、大手筋脇には石垣と盛土があり建物跡が推定され、「丹波国ではもっとも優れている水の手曲輪」と『中世城郭辞典』は指摘している。
sen.e: The south side kuruwa next to it, along side Otesuji, there are remains of stonewall and a earthen mound, and these remains give the supposition that there was a building there, and according to "Chusei Shokaku Jiten," it was 'the most excellent 'mizu-no-te guruwa' in Tanba Province.'

In the adjacent southern compound and beside Otesuji are a stone wall and an earthen mound that are believed to be the remains of a building which "Chusei Shokaku Jiten" claims was "the most excellent mizu-no-te guruwa in Tanba Province".
